column4: i tried several times....... my audio input still nto working.......
also PCM ...... so i could record what i play and so on
i dont understand, why linux, Ubuntu to be exact, gives me 100s of diferent mixers to choose from
many soundcards allow piping output into input, look at your mixer, record settings, if there's some "capture" toggle or slider, or something like that.
yes, you udnerstand me!! :) but i cant found anything on that
pastebin the output of "amixer" and i can try to guess what the right setting is, if any
i don't think i see the right setting, unless it's "Analog Mix", but i doubt it

another possibility is a program that steals the dsp output and writes it to a file, except the name of it escapes me right now. (alsa can possibly also do that, but i have no idea about the configuration to achieve it)
i suppose that skype doesn't just have a function to send an audio file?
well, do you absolutely have to do it real time, can't you pre-record the whole thing for him?
i can't say it's impossible, but at least it's not trivial. as much as i hate hardware solutions, an actual loop cable is a cheap solution
